meanings.definition: To create or express in a formulaic manner.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys formulizing her thoughts into structured plans.
meanings.sent2: The scientist is formulizing the data to present it clearly.
meanings.sent3: John couldn't resist formulizing his daily routine into a detailed schedule.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic process involves formulizing chaos into organized patterns.
meanings.sent5: By formulizing his ideas, he was able to see the logical progression clearly.

meanings.definition: To make something into a formula.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is formulizing the equation for the students to understand easily.
meanings.sent2: They are formulizing the recipe to share it with others.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried formulizing his disappearing act but ended up revealing the trick.
meanings.sent4: She is formulizing the secret sauce recipe to keep it consistent.
meanings.sent5: Formulizing the process will help streamline the workflow.

meanings.definition: To turn something into a formula.
meanings.sent1: The mathematician is formulizing the problem to solve it step by step.
meanings.sent2: They are formulizing the complex concept into an easy-to-understand formula.
meanings.sent3: The inventor was excited about formulizing his invention for mass production.
meanings.sent4: By formulizing the strategy, they were able to replicate their success.
meanings.sent5: Formulizing the idea made it accessible to everyone.
